{{Multiple issues| {{news release|1=article|date=August 2015}} {{COI|date=August 2015}} }}
'''''Utenti Pubblicità Associati''''' (UPA) is the Italian Advertisers' Association, based in [[Milan]].
==History== ''Utenti Pubblicità Associati'' (UPA) was founded in 1948 to represent the interests of Italian advertisers. The association engages actively and proactively with industry, political, legislative and regulatory bodies, while helping its members enhance the effectiveness of their advertising through a range of services. These currently include free consultancy, market monitoring data and surveys from a variety of media research companies that are either owned or supported by UPA.<ref>[http://www.upa.it/eng/activitiesservices/advertising-media/index.html UPA website list of member services<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
The Association is a member of the [[World Federation of Advertisers]] (WFA), supports the [[Italian Advertising Self-Regulation Institute]] and sponsors the [[University Ca’ Foscari]] of Venice Master in Business Communications.
The UPA's Board and active members include the directors of many of Italy's leading companies and multinationals.<ref>[http://www.upa.it/eng/profileandmission/boarddirections/index.html UPA Board of Directors<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
===Giulio Malgara presidency=== Much of the groundwork for the UPA's recent achievements was laid by Giulio Malgara, its President from 1984 to 2007 and currently President of Quaker Europe<ref>[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9D0CEED7103FF932A15755C0A967958260 New York Times: "Realignment At Quaker Oats"<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and Chairman and Managing Director of the bakery products company [[Malgara Chiari Forti SpA]]. Malgara was particularly influential in giving the UPA a strong research basis, founding the television audience research company [[Auditel]] in 1984.<ref>[http://www.repubblica.it/2005/f/sezioni/politica/cdarai3/schedamalg/schedamalg.html La Repubblica: "Malgara, the man who invented Auditel"<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://archiviostorico.corriere.it/2005/luglio/16/Bisio_alla_Gialappa_comici_sinistra_co_9_050716003.shtml Corriere della Sera article on TV advertising<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
===Lorenzo Sassoli de Bianchi presidency=== [[Lorenzo Sassoli de Bianchi]], the founder of Italy's leading health food company, [[Valsoia]], and President of the [[Bologna Museum of Modern Art]] (MAMbo), took over from Malgara in June 2007.<ref>[http://ilvalore.leonardo.it/?sezione=8&idnews=982&ln=0 Il Valore: "Giulio Malgara succeeded by Sassoli de Bianchi as President of the UPA"<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Widely respected by Italian industrialists for Valsoia's use of cross-media advertising and his personal skills as a communicator and consensus-builder, Sassoli de Bianchi was appointed President on a modernising agenda. Acting in the participative style for which he is renowned and applying the methodology he developed at Valsoia, Sassoli de Bianchi immediately worked with the organisation's active members to formulate a clear mission statement and objectives, as well as to restructure the governance of the association and to increase participation, accountability, innovation and transparency.
The projects launched under this programme include a research centre, initiatives to promote regional representation and national growth, and an extensive series of services and strategic partnerships to help members orient themselves with respect to the complex and rapidly changing social, regulatory and technological developments in modern advertising.
Lorenzo Sassoli de Bianchi was reappointed President of the UPA for a further 3 years in 2009.<ref>[http://www.primaonline.it/2009/07/01/72496/sassoli-de-bianchi-upa-le-aziende-per-vivere-hanno-bisogno-della-pubblicita Lorenzo Sassoli de Bianchi reappointed President of the UPA<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
As well as playing a [[lobbying]] and educating role, the UPA adopts a proactive partnership approach in its dealings with the government, legal and regulatory authorities, advertising agencies and the media, supported by issuing regular trend reports and analyses. These initiatives have consolidated the already influential role, profile and authority of the UPA, which organised a large international conference held in Rome in March 2009.<ref>[http://www.tuttocambia.it/eng Website for the International Conference "Tutto cambia. Cambiamo tutto?"<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.upa.it}}

{{use British English|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox award | name = World Branding Awards | subheader = <!-- or | current_awards = --> | image = [[File:World Branding Awards logo.png|180px]] | image_size = | alt = World Branding Awards logo | caption = | description = Excellence in [[Brand management|branding]] | sponsor = | date = <!-- {{start date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | location = [[Kensington Palace]], [[London]]; [[Hofburg Palace]], [[Vienna]]; [[Plaza Hotel|The Plaza]], [[New York City|New York]] | country = | presenter = [[World Branding Forum]] | hosts = [[David Croft (broadcaster)|David Croft]], [[Olivia Wayne]], [[Moody McCarthy]] | former name = | preshow_host = | acts = [[Ben Hanlin]] | reward = | year = 2014 | year2 = | holder_label = Winners | holder = [[List of World Branding Awards winners]] | most_wins = [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], [[British Airways]], [[Barclays]], [[Coca-Cola]], [[HSBC]], [[McDonald's]], [[VISA]] | most_nominations = | award1_type = | award1_winner = | award2_type = | award2_winner = | award3_type = | award3_winner = | award4_type = | award4_winner = | award5_type = | award5_winner = | website = {{URL|https://awards.brandingforum.org/}} | network = <!-- or | network_list = --> | runtime = | viewership = <!-- or | ratings = --> | producer = | director = | image2 = | image2size = <!-- or | image_upright2 --> | alt2 = | caption2 = | previous = | main = | next = }}
The '''World Branding Awards''' is an international award presented to global and national brands for their work and achievements in [[brand management|branding]].<ref name=TTR>{{cite news|title=Taiwan’s Acer and Chatime Honoured at the 2014 World Branding Awards|url=http://taiwantradereview.com/taiwans-acer-and-chatime-honoured-at-the-2014-world-branding-awards/|accessdate=5 December 2014|publisher=Taiwan Trade Review|date=29 Oct 2014}}</ref> The [[World Branding Forum]], a registered global non-profit organisation based in London, organises the awards.<ref name=star-maybank>{{cite news|title=Maybank awarded Brand of the Year at World Branding Forum|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Business/Business-News/2014/10/29/Maybank-awarded-Brand-of-the-Year-at-World-Branding-Forum/?style=biz|accessdate=5 December 2014|publisher=The Star|date=29 Oct 2014}}</ref>
There are three tiers of awards. A Global Award is presented to international brands, a Regional Award is presented to brands that are top in several countries in a particular geographic region, and a National Award is presented to brands from participating countries.<ref name=wba-entry/> The awards trophy is on display at the [[Museum of Brands, Packaging & Advertising]] in London.<ref name=herald/> The award's Brand of the Year logo is a [[trademark|registered trademark]].<ref name="EUIPO">{{cite web|title=World branding Awards Brand Of The Year|url=https://euipo.europa.eu/eSearch/#details/trademarks/014433148|website=EUIPO|publisher=European Union Intellectual Property Office|accessdate=8 February 2017}}</ref>
The 2015, 2016 and 2017 award ceremonies took place at [[Kensington Palace]] in London.<ref name=Reuters-KP/><ref name=kuwait-times-gulf-insurance/><ref name="AppleWorld-16">{{cite news|last1=Sellers|first1=Dennis|title=Apple among 210 winners of the 2016 World Branding Awards|url=https://www.appleworld.today/blog/2016/9/21/apple-among-210-winners-of-the-2016-world-branding-awards|accessdate=8 February 2017|publisher=Apple World Today|date=21 September 2016}}</ref> In 2017, an edition of the awards, called the Animalis Edition, was held in the [[Hofburg Palace]] in [[Vienna]].<ref name="arabnews-animalis17">{{cite news|title=UAE brands among winners of ‘World Branding Awards’|url=http://www.arabnews.com/node/1121571/corporate-news|accessdate=8 September 2017|publisher=Arab News|date=29 June 2017}}</ref> It is the world's largest animal and pet branding awards ceremony.<ref name="wba-animalis">{{cite web|title=Animalis Edition|url=https://awards.brandingforum.org/animalis/|website=World Branding Awards|publisher=World Branding Forum|accessdate=11 May 2017}}</ref> In 2018, the Americas Edition of the awards was held at [[Plaza Hotel|The Plaza]] on [[Fifth Avenue]] in [[New York City]].<ref name="CaribbeanBusiness">{{cite news |title=Banco Popular among 81 winners at World Branding Awards |url=https://caribbeanbusiness.com/banco-popular-among-81-winners-at-world-branding-awards/ |accessdate=3 September 2018 |publisher=Caribbean Business |date=20 July 2018}}</ref>
==Nominations, judging and scoring== Nominations for the awards can be made by brands owners, custodians, agencies or the public.<ref name=wba-entry>{{cite web|title=[edit] Nomination & Voting Branding Entries & Public Voting|url=https://awards.brandingforum.org/the-awards/|website=World Branding Awards|publisher=World Branding Forum|accessdate=16 February 2015}}</ref> There are three tiers of awards: a Global Award is presented to international brands that have a presence in ten or more countries, on three or more continents, limited to the top 100 global brands in any particular year; a Regional Award is presented to brands that are top in several countries in a particular geographic region; and a National Award which is presented to the top brands in participating countries at the awards. Brands that are global winners are not awarded again on a national level.<ref name=wba-entry/>
Winners of the awards are judged through three streams: brand valuation, consumer market research and public online voting. There are also other awards for individuals voted for by the World Branding Forum Advisory Council, which consists of luminaries from the world of branding.<ref name=TTR/> Winners go through a stringent assessment process to determine the level of work put in by a brand for their branding activities. The level of trust that the brands’ customers and the public have for the brand is also taken into account.<ref name=borneo-post>{{cite news|title=SEGi, sole winner of international education brand award for Malaysia|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/11/19/segi-sole-winner-of-international-education-brand-award-for-malaysia/|accessdate=13 February 2015|publisher=Borneo Post|date=19 Nov 2014}}</ref>
==Trophy== [[File:World Branding Awards Trophy.jpg|thumb|The 24 karat gold plated World Branding Awards trophy is on display at the [[Museum of Brands, Packaging & Advertising]] in London.]] The award trophies are made in [[Stratford-upon-Avon]]. The first trophies were manufactured in nickel and gold plate and accented in acrylic with a design focus on the World Branding Forum's logo.<ref name=EFX>{{cite web|title=EFX Acclaimed for World Branding Awards|url=http://www.awardefx.co.uk/uploads/email/efxnewsnovember14/newsnovember14.html|website=EFX|publisher=EFX|accessdate=13 February 2015}}</ref> In 2016, a newly designed [[24 karat]] gold-plated trophy was introduced for all winners. This new design is a solid trophy with no acrylic, and highlights the "Brand of the Year" registered trademark logo.<ref name=AppleWorld-16/> It is {{cvt|245|mm}} in height and {{cvt|76|mm}} in diameter with an angled top, and weighs {{cvt|1.8|kg}}.<ref name="trophy">{{cite web|title=The Trophy|url=https://awards.brandingforum.org/the-awards/trophy/|website=World Branding Awards|publisher=World Branding Forum|accessdate=21 March 2017}}</ref>
The trophy is on display at the [[Museum of Brands, Packaging & Advertising]] in London.<ref name=herald>{{cite news|title=World Branding Forum Sponsors Museum of Brands, Packaging and Advertising Education Project|url=http://www.heraldonline.com/2015/02/09/6781165_world-branding-forum-sponsors.html?rh=1|accessdate=13 February 2015|publisher=Herald Online|date=9 Feb 2015}}</ref>
==Award ceremonies==
===2018–2019 Awards=== In 2018, the Americas Edition of the awards was held at [[Plaza Hotel|The Plaza]] on [[Fifth Avenue]] in [[New York City]]. Twenty-two countries from the [[Americas]] and the [[Caribbean]] participated.<ref name="CaribbeanBusiness">{{cite news |title=Banco Popular among 81 winners at World Branding Awards |url=https://caribbeanbusiness.com/banco-popular-among-81-winners-at-world-branding-awards/ |accessdate=3 September 2018 |publisher=Caribbean Business |date=20 July 2018}}</ref> Over 80,000 consumers voted for more than 1,500 brands, but only 81 brands from 16 countries were awarded. Comedian [[Moody McCarthy]] hosted the event.<ref name="barchart-birks">{{cite news |title=Canadian Brands Celebrated at the Americas Edition of the World Branding Awards in New York |url=https://www.barchart.com/story/futures/commitment-of-traders/technical-charts/RBU17/overview/964637/canadian-brands-celebrated-at-the-americas-edition-of-the-world-branding-awards-in-new-york |accessdate=3 September 2018 |publisher=Bar Chart |date=19 July 2018}}</ref>
===2017–2018 Awards=== [[File:World Branding Awards trophies.jpg|thumb|The original World Branding Awards trophies, before they were replaced with a new design in 2016]] Over 135,000 consumers from around the world voted for more than 3,000 brands from 35 countries in 2017.<ref name="wba-winners-2017">{{cite web|title=World Branding Awards - 2017-2018 Winners|url=https://awards.brandingforum.org/winners-2017-2018/|publisher=World Branding Forum|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref> 245 winners were awarded.<ref name="mb-tanduay-17">{{cite news|title=Tanduay named ‘Brand of the Year’ at the World Branding Awards|url=https://news.mb.com.ph/2017/11/10/tanduay-named-brand-of-the-year/|accessdate=10 April 2018|publisher=Manila Bulletin|date=10 Nov 2017}}</ref> The awards ceremony was held in [[Kensington Palace]] in London.<ref name="kuwait-times-gulf-insurance">{{cite news|title=Gulf Insurance Group named ‘Insurance Brand of Year’ by World Branding Awards|url=http://news.kuwaittimes.net/website/gulf-insurance-group-named-insurance-brand-year-world-branding-awards/|accessdate=10 April 2018|publisher=Kuwait Times}}</ref>
In the same year, the Animalis edition of the awards saw 92 brands from 35 countries named Brand of the Year in a ceremony held at the [[Hofburg Palace]] in [[Vienna]]. This edition focused on pet and animal brands.<ref name="arab-news-animalis17">{{cite news |title=UAE brands among winners of ‘World Branding Awards’ |url=http://www.arabnews.com/node/1121571/corporate-news |accessdate=4 September 2018 |publisher=Arab News |date=28 June 2017}}</ref>
===2016–2017 Awards=== This edition of the awards saw over 120,000 consumers from around the world voting for more than 2,800 brands from 35 countries.<ref name="TBN-KP16">{{cite news|title=Thai Brands among 210 Winners of the 2016 World Branding Awards at Kensington Palace|url=http://thaibusinessnews.com/readnews.php?id=116|accessdate=8 February 2017|publisher=Thai Business News|date=21 September 2016}}</ref> 210 brands from 30 countries were declared winners. The ceremony was held in Kensington Palace.<ref name=AppleWorld-16/> Among the attendees was the United Arab Emirates Ambassador to the United Kingdom, Sulaiman Almazroui,<ref name="GADF16">{{cite news|last1=Noor|first1=Hibah|title=Dubai Duty Free wins Brand of the Year Award|url=http://www.dutyfreemagazine.ca/gulf-africa/industry-news/operator-news/2016/09/28/dubai-duty-free-wins-brand-of-the-year-award/#.WJsGun-8ZEY|accessdate=8 February 2017|publisher=Gulf-Africa Duty Free|date=28 September 2016}}</ref> and the Philippines Ambassador, Evan Garcia.<ref name="FilEmb">{{cite web|title=World Branding Awards recognize Philippine brands|url=http://londonpe.dfa.gov.ph/embassy-news/339-wbf2016|website=Embassy of the Philippines|accessdate=14 February 2017}}</ref> [[David Croft (broadcaster)|David Croft]] of [[Sky Sports]] hosted the event.<ref name=TBN-KP16/>
===2015–2016 Awards=== For the 2015–2016 period, more than 65,000 consumers voted for 2,600 nominated brands from 35 countries. 118 brands from 30 countries were eventually declared winners.<ref name="Reuters-KP">{{cite web|title=Seven Thai Brands Win Big At The 2015 World Branding Awards at London’s Kensington Palace|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/world-branding-forum-idUSnBw255692a+100+BSW20150925|website=Reuters|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=18 March 2016|ref=reuters-kp15}}</ref> The awards ceremony took place on 24 September 2015 at the State Apartments of Kensington Palace. [[Olivia Wayne]] of Sky Sports hosted the event.<ref name=Reuters-KP/>
===2014–2015 Awards=== Over 2,500 brands from 35 countries were nominated for the Awards for the 2014–2015 period.<ref name=adhocnews>{{cite news|title=he World Branding Awards took place today in Paris, France|url=http://www.ad-hoc-news.de/the-world-branding-awards-took-place-today-in-paris-france--/de/News/42681762|accessdate=16 May 2015|publisher=Ad Hoc News|date=24 March 2015}}</ref> Of these, 119 brands were awarded.<ref name=antara-paris>{{cite news|title=Indosat and Acer Wins for Indonesia at the World Branding Awards|url=http://www.antaranews.com/en/news/98264/indosat-and-acer-wins-for-indonesia-at-the-world-branding-awards|accessdate=16 May 2015|agency=Antara News|date=25 March 2015}}</ref>
====London ceremony==== The London awards ceremony was held on 26 October 2014, at [[Whitehall Court|One Whitehall Place]], the events building of the [[Royal Horseguards Hotel]]. David Croft hosted the event.<ref name=YahooFinance>{{cite web|title=Asian Brands Honoured at the 2014 World Branding Awards|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/asian-brands-honoured-2014-world-160500286.html|website=Yahoo Finance|publisher=Yahoo|accessdate=13 February 2015|ref=YahooFinance}}</ref> The format of the ceremony included a cocktail reception followed by a gala dinner.<ref name=EFX/>
====Paris ceremony==== The [[Paris]] awards ceremony took place on 25 March 2015, at the iconic [[:fr:Hilton Paris Opéra]] in France. This second instalment of the 2014–2015 awards emphasised food, beverage, luxury, fashion, lifestyle, hospitality, and service brands, where 50 brands from 22 countries were awarded.<ref name=IIFL>{{cite news|title=SBI wins ‘Brand of the Year’ Award at The World Branding Awards in Paris|url=http://www.indiainfoline.com/article/news-sector-banking-financials/sbi-wins-brand-of-the-year-award-at-the-world-branding-awards-in-paris-115033000155_1.html|accessdate=16 May 2015|publisher=Indian Info Line|date=30 March 2015}}</ref>
French TV and movie actress, Sara Verhagen, presented the awards. Magician, [[Ben Hanlin]], star of [[ITV2]]’s hidden camera magic show, ''[[Tricked (TV series)|Tricked]]'', and [[Discovery Channel]]'s ''Breaking Magic'' provided the entertainment.<ref name=benhanlin>{{cite news|title=Ben Hanlin to Perform at the World Branding Awards Paris 2015 Ceremony|url=https://brandingforum.org/press-release/ben-hanlin-to-perform-at-the-world-branding-awards-paris-2015-ceremony/|accessdate=16 May 2015|publisher=World Branding Forum|date=16 February 2015}}</ref>
==Winners== {{main|List of World Branding Awards winners}} ===2018 Winners=== [[File:Plaza Hotel May 2010.JPG|thumb|The Americas edition took place at the Plaza Hotel in [[New York City|New York]].]] The 2018–2019 Americas Edition of the awards took place at the Plaza Hotel on [[Fifth Avenue]] in New York City. More than 1,500 Americas and Caribbean brands from 22 countries participated, and 81 brands from 16 countries were awarded.<ref name=CaribbeanBusiness/>
===2017 Winners=== [[File:Wien - Neue Hofburg.JPG|thumb|The Animalis edition was presented at the [[Hofburg Palace]] in [[Vienna]].]] The 2017–2018 awards ceremony took place in Kensington Palace in London, where 245 winners were awarded.<ref name=mb-tanduay-17/> The Animalis edition, which focused on pet and animal brands, was held at the Hofburg Palace in Vienna, where 92 brands from 35 countries were awarded.<ref name=arab-news-animalis17/>
===2016 Winners=== The 2016–2017 awards ceremony took place in Kensington Palace, where 210 brands from 30 countries were awarded. [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], [[BMW]], the [[British Council]], [[Cartier (jeweler)|Cartier]], [[Coca-Cola]], [[Facebook]], [[Google]], [[Lego]], [[L'Oréal]], [[Louis Vuitton]], [[McDonald's]], [[Nescafé]], [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]], [[Oral-B]], [[Pampers]], [[Rolex]], [[Samsung]], [[Starbucks]], [[Schwarzkopf]] and [[VISA]] were announced as global winners.<ref name=TBN-KP16/>
National tier winners included: [[ICBC]] (China), [[Bang & Olufsen]] (Denmark), [[Hermès]] (France), [[Nivea]] (Germany), [[Chow Tai Fook]] (Hong Kong), [[State Bank of India]], [[Indofood|Indomilk]] (Indonesia), [[Prada]] (Italy), [[Sukiya (restaurant chain)|Sukiya]] (Japan), [[Maybank]] (Malaysia), [[Dulux]] (Netherlands), [[SM Supermalls]] (Philippines), [[Sberbank]] (Russia), [[Nando's]] (South Africa), [[Amorepacific Corporation|AmorePacific]] (South Korea), [[Santander Group|Santander]] (Spain), [[King Power]] (Thailand), [[Zurich Insurance Group|Zurich]] (Switzerland), [[Dubai Duty Free]] (UAE), and [[Prudential plc|Prudential]] (UK), among others.<ref name=TBN-KP16/>
Regional winners included: [[Eu Yan Sang]], [[Giordano (store)|Giordano]], [[Lee Kum Kee]], [[Mandarin Oriental]] and [[Watsons]] from Hong Kong; [[Indomie]] (Indonesia); [[Ajinomoto]], [[Isetan]], [[Kikkoman]] and [[Uniqlo]] from Japan; [[MTN Group|MTN]] from South Africa; [[Zara (retailer)|Zara]] (Spain); and [[RAK Ceramics]] (UAE).<ref name=TBN-KP16/>
===2015 Winners=== [[File:Victoria statue Kensington.jpg|thumb|The 2015, 2016 and 2017 World Branding Awards were held at London's [[Kensington Palace]].]] Kensington Palace in London was the site of the 2015–2016 awards ceremony. 118 brands from 30 countries were awarded.<ref name=Reuters-KP/> Global winners included: Apple Inc., Cartier, Coca-Cola, Facebook, Google, [[Guinness]], [[HSBC]], [[IKEA]], [[Johnnie Walker]], [[Kleenex]], Lego, Louis Vuitton, McDonald's, [[Mercedes-Benz]], Nescafé, Nike, Inc., Rolex, [[Royal Dutch Shell|Shell]], Starbucks and VISA.<ref name="tradearabia15">{{cite web|title=118 brands honoured at World Branding Awards|url=http://www.tradearabia.com/news/MEDIA_291089.html|website=TradeArabia|publisher=TradeArabia|accessdate=18 March 2016|ref=tradearabia15}}</ref> National tier winners from around the world include [[ANZ Bank]] from Australia, [[Sinopec]] from China, [[Hugo Boss]] from Germany, [[Airtel]] from India, Prada from Italy, [[Seiko]] from Japan, Samsung from Korea, Gulf Insurance Group from Kuwait, Maybank from Malaysia, [[KLM]] from the Netherlands, [[Babcock University]] from Nigeria, [[HBL Pakistan|HBL Bank]] from Pakistan, [[Tanduay|Tanduay Rum]] from the Philippines, [[Chunghwa Telecom]] from Taiwan, MTN Group from South Africa, Santander Group from Spain, [[Singha|Singha Beer]] from Thailand, Dubai Duty Free from the UAE, and [[Royal Mail]] from the United Kingdom.<ref name=Reuters-KP/> RAK Ceramics won a regional award for being one of the largest brands in its category in the Middle East.<ref name="gulf-news15">{{cite web|title=ADNOC, Dubai Duty Free and RAK Ceramics Named “Brand of the Year” At The 2015 World Branding Awards at Kensington Palace|url=http://www.gulfnews247.com/2015/09/27/adnoc-dubai-duty-free-and-rak-ceramics-named-brand-of-the-year-at-the-2015-world-branding-awards-at-kensington-palace/|website=Gulf News 24/7|publisher=Gulf News 24/7|accessdate=18 March 2016}}</ref>
===2014 Winners=== The London awards ceremony in 2014 saw 69 brands from 25 countries awarded. Global winners included: Apple Inc., Coca-Cola, [[Fresh Del Monte Produce|Del Monte]], [[Heinz (company)|Heinz]], HSBC, Louis Vuitton, [[McDonald’s]], Samsung, [[Sony PlayStation]] and VISA.<ref name=SunStar/> National tier winners include [[Barclays]], the [[BBC]], [[British Airways]], [[Thomas Cook Group|Thomas Cook]], the [[University of Oxford]], Lego, [[Ferrari]], Royal Dutch Shell, Silentnight,<ref name=furniturenews>{{cite news|last1=Paul|first1=Farley|title=Silentnight triumphs at World Branding Awards|url=http://www.furniturenews.net/news/articles/2014/12/65915498-silentnight-triumphs-world-branding-awards|accessdate=13 February 2015|date=11 Dec 2014}}</ref> and [[Burj Al Arab|Burj Al Arab Jumeirah]]. Each brand is named Brand of the Year in their respective categories.<ref name=YahooFinance/> The awards gave special recognition to [[Tony Fernandes]], Group CEO of [[AirAsia]], naming him Brand Builder of the Year for his outstanding work in building the airline brand.<ref name=SunStar>{{cite news|title=AirAsia Awarded Brand of the Year in Airline Category|url=http://www.sunstar.com.ph/cagayan-de-oro/business/2014/11/04/airasia-awarded-brand-year-airline-category-374601|accessdate=5 December 2014|publisher=Sun Star|date=4 Nov 2014}}</ref>
At the 2014–2015 Paris awards ceremony, 50 brands from 22 countries were awarded.<ref name=FNI>{{cite news|title=State Bank of India wins ‘Brand of the Year’ Award at The World Branding Awards|url=http://forevernews.in/state-bank-of-india-wins-brand-of-the-year-award-at-the-world-branding-awards/|accessdate=16 May 2015|publisher=Forever news India|date=30 March 2015}}</ref> Global winners included Cartier, [[Club Med]], [[Evian]], [[Gillette (brand)|Gillette]], [[Gucci]], Hermès, [[Hilton Hotels & Resorts]], IKEA, [[L’Oréal]], [[Moët & Chandon]], Nike, Inc., Prada and [[United Parcel Service|UPS]]. National tier winners included: [[Penfolds]] (Australia); [[China Telecom]]; [[Media Markt]] (Germany); [[Taj Hotels Resorts and Palaces]] (India); [[Indosat]] (Indonesia); [[NTT Docomo]] (Japan); [[SK Telecom]] (Korea); [[Pos Malaysia]]; [[Campina (company)|Campina]] (Netherlands); [[SMRT Corporation|SMRT]] (Singapore); [[Telkom (South Africa)|Telkom]] (South Africa); [[Hoffmann-La Roche|Roche]] (Switzerland); Chunghwa Telecom (Taiwan); and [[Eurostar]] (UK). Each brand was named Brand of the Year in their respective categories.<ref name=yahoo-fin-paris>{{cite news|title=World Branding Awards Honours F&B, Luxury, Fashion, Lifestyle, Hospitality and Service Brands|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/world-branding-awards-honours-f-200000754.html|accessdate=16 May 2015|publisher=Yahoo Finance|date=24 March 2015}}</ref>
==Presenters== For the 2014 awards, the London ceremony at One Whitehall Place was presented by [[David Croft (broadcaster)|David Croft]] from [[Sky Sports]],<ref name=boston-apple>{{cite news|title=Apple, Coca-Cola, HSBC and Louis Vuitton Named "Brand of the Year" at the 2014 World Branding Awards|url=http://finance.boston.com/boston/news/read/28565434/Apple|accessdate=13 February 2015|publisher=Boston Globe|date=28 Oct 2014}}</ref> while French actress Sara Verhagen presented the Paris ceremony.<ref name="EPL">{{cite web|title=World Branding Awards|url=http://www.eventphotographerlondon.org/uncategorized/world-branding-awards/|website=Event Photographer London|accessdate=27 May 2016}}</ref> Magician Ben Hanlin from ITV2's ''Tricked (TV series)|Tricked'' and Discovery Channel's ''Breaking Magic'' also performed at the Paris event.<ref name="wbf-hanlin">{{cite news|title=Ben Hanlin to Perform at the World Branding Awards Paris 2015 Ceremony|url=https://brandingforum.org/press-release/ben-hanlin-to-perform-at-the-world-branding-awards-paris-2015-ceremony/|accessdate=27 May 2016|publisher=World Branding Forum}}</ref>
The 2015 awards ceremony at Kensington Palace was presented by Olivia Wayne from Sky Sports,<ref name="quamnet">{{cite news|title=Seven Thai Brands Win Big At The 2015 World Branding Awards at London’s Kensington Palace|url=http://www.quamnet.com/newscontent.action;jsessionid=511AE12779AC27475C2297CBB67F074E?request_locale=en_US&articleId=4387926|accessdate=27 May 2016|publisher=Quamnet|date=26 Sep 2015}}</ref> and David Croft presented the 2016 and 2017 awards.<ref name=TBN-KP16/> The 2017 Animalis edition in Vienna was presented by [[:de:Stuart Freeman]],<ref name="wba-presenters">{{cite web |title=Presenters |url=https://awards.brandingforum.org/the-awards/presenters/ |website=World Branding Awards |publisher=World Branding Forum |accessdate=4 September 2018}}</ref> while comedian [[Moody McCarthy]] hosted the 2018 Americas Edition of the awards in New York.<ref name=barchart-birks/>

'''York Liao, [[Order of the British Empire|MBE]], [[Silver Bauhinia Star|SBS]], [[Justice of the Peace|JP]]''' (born ca. 1948) is a [[China|Chinese]]-born Hong Kong government official and businessman, who is or has been: * a Managing Director of Winbridge Company Limited, a private investment and consultancy company * an Independent Non-Executive Director of Hang Lung Group Ltd (since October 2003) * a Non-Executive Director of Armitage Technologies Holding Ltd (since February 2002) * a cofounder (along with Dr C C Chang and Mr James Lee) of Varitronix International Ltd in 1978, one of the first manufacturers of LCD.<ref>[http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=4017113&ticker=10:HK Profile], businessweek.com; accessed 20 October 2014.</ref>
==Affiliations== * City Polytechnic (now City University) Council * University of Science and Technology Council * University Grants Committee (the overseeing body appointed by the government for the funding of tertiary education in Hong Kong) * Industrial and Technology Development Council * Hong Kong Industrial Technology Center, [[LegCo|government]]-sponsored incubation center * [[California Institute of Technology]] ("Caltech") Board of Trustees (since 1998)<ref name="caltech">[https://www.caltech.edu/content/york-liao-elected-caltech-board Profile], caltech.edu; accessed 20 October 2014.</ref>
==Education== Born in [[People's Republic of China|China]] and raised in Hong Kong, Liao came to the United States to attend [[California Institute of Technology|Caltech]], where he earned a BS in physics in 1967. He continued his studies in applied physics at [[Harvard University]], and was awarded an MA (1968) and a Ph.D (1973).<ref>[http://www.sfc.hk/edistributionWeb/gateway/EN/news-and-announcements/news/doc?refNo=05PR124 Profile], sfc.hk; accessed 20 October 2014.</ref>
==Personal life== York Liao is married and has three children. His sister is Dr. [[Sarah Liao]].<ref name="caltech"/>
